medical_history.chief_complaint: Chest pain and shortness of breath
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced the onset of stabbing substernal chest pain that radiated to the left shoulder and jaw upon awakening in the morning. The pain, rated at 7 out of 10, was associated with shortness of breath and worsened over several hours before seeking medical attention.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, renal-artery stenosis (stent placed 2.5 years earlier), chronic renal insufficiency, gastroesophageal reflux disease, hypercholesterolemia, cholelithiasis, osteoporosis, osteoarthritis, dementia (poor memory and insight), and history of adenocarcinoma of the colon treated with sigmoid colectomy 4 years earlier (recovery complicated by postoperative myocardial infarction).
medical_history.family_history: Sister had hypertension, atrial fibrillation, and adenomatous colonic polyps. Other relatives had had congestive heart failure.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is a widow, lives with a friend, receives assistance in the home from elder services, does not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs.
